description.narrative: The Solidarity Center provides training and mentoring as well as technical support so that independent trade unions can be an effective vehicle for promoting fundamental rights in Mexico. In partnership with unions and civil society organizations, the Solidarity Center focuses on organizing workers and building capacity in key Mexican industries that have the potential to reshape labor relations and set important precedents for protecting workers’ individual and collective rights. The Solidarity Center also provides legal support as workers advocate for better enforcement of existing labor laws and labor reforms.

The Solidarity Center supports the building and strengthening of independent trade unions in Mexico to represent worker interests, protect worker rights through collective bargaining and social dialogue, combat corruption in labor relations, promote gender equality in the workplace and advocate for rule of law and access to justice for workers.
